item.title: [pi] wildy outside bank/making delay on range target and adding animation to it
item.dc:creator: @s_w_3_3_t1 s w 3 3 t1
item.description:
@s_w_3_3_t1 wrote:

this is in my client.java

[code]	if(inWild()) {
              if (isSafe()) {
		int modY = absY > 6400 ?  absY - 6400 : absY;
		wildLevel = (((modY - 3520) / 8) + 4);
		getPA().walkableInterface(197);
		if(Config.SINGLE_AND_MULTI_ZONES) {
			if(inMulti()) {
				getPA().sendFrame126("@yel@Level: "+wildLevel, 199);
			} else {
				getPA().sendFrame126("@yel@Level: "+wildLevel, 199);
			}
		} else {
			getPA().multiWay(-1);
			getPA().sendFrame126("@yel@Level: "+wildLevel, 199);
		}
		getPA().showOption(3, 0, "Attack", 1);
           } [code]

and i add this above the inwild bit in player.java

[code] public boolean isSafe() {
if (absX > 3250 && absY > 3416 && absX < 3257 && absY < 3423) {
return true;
}
return false;
} [code]

but it says im in wildy, please help, i am going to bed il check this first thing in the morning hoping for someone to help thankyou[/code]

Read full topic
item.source: [pi] wildy outside bank/making delay on range target and adding animation to it

item.title: [pi] wildy outside bank/making delay on range target and adding animation to it
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

Try

public boolean isSafe(absX, absY) {
    if (absX > 3250 && absY > 3416 && absX < 3257 && absY < 3423) {
	return true;
    } else {
	return false;
    }
}

public boolean isInPvP(absX, absY) {
    if (absX > 2940 && absY > 3216 && absX < 3326 && absY < 3551) {
	return true;
    } else {
	return false;
    }
}
if(isInPvP()) {
    if (isSafe()) {
	getPA().sendFrame126("@yel@SAFE", 199);
    } else {
        int modY = absY > 6400 ?  absY - 6400 : absY;
        wildLevel = (((modY - 3520) / 8) + 1);
        getPA().walkableInterface(197);
        if(Config.SINGLE_AND_MULTI_ZONES) {
            if(inMulti()) {
            	getPA().sendFrame126("@yel@Level: "+wildLevel, 199);
            } else {
                getPA().sendFrame126("@yel@Level: "+wildLevel, 199);
            }
    } else {
            getPA().multiWay(-1);
            getPA().sendFrame126("@yel@Level: "+wildLevel, 199);
    }
    getPA().showOption(3, 0, "Attack", 1);
}

Read full topic
item.source: [pi] wildy outside bank/making delay on range target and adding animation to it

item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

If you’re following the comparing conventions that are used in PI, you’ll have to use your bottom left, top right co-ordinates.

item.title: [pi] wildy outside bank/making delay on range target and adding animation to it
item.dc:creator: @Ashton51 Ashton51
item.description:
@Ashton51 wrote:

[quote=“ytuio9, post:29, topic:386556”][quote author=Ashton51 link=topic=482323.msg3533628#msg3533628 date=1300395150]

First of all, if you use multiple conditions for the boolean you can cover the whole area.
Second of all, use [ code] [/ code] tags when posting any compiling errors or code. It makes it much easier to read instead of that huge block of text…
@uberpk3r: I believe you use the bottom left and top right corner.

You need to make a new location for that. You do not need to touch ranging methods, create a new area called newWilderness add the coords to it, add the boolean to the wilderness code.

It’s just a new boolean, no need to add a new location…

since he want wilderness in a specific area its a new location, I don’t want to argument about this since i’m not 100% sure what i’m talking about, but the coords should not matter like that. I might have, im more RSC guy, been doing that for 2-3 years moving to RS2 isn’t that easy but looks pretty much the same.

First co-ords are the bottom left corner because you go >= them. Try drawing it on a cartesian plane, you’ll see what I mean.

Doesn’t matter which two corners you use, Since the coordinates are based on vertical and horizontal lines, not points.

The area is not like this

. .

. .

but like this

l l
l l

The ----- being the Y coordinate and the l being the X coordinate

so…

…
. .
. .
…

eight dots. Does that mean

if (absX > 0 && absY > 0 && absX < 8 && absY < 8) {

is the same as saying

if (absX > 0 && abs Y > 8 && absX < 8 && absY < 0) {

?

Not at all, Thats completely different, You just said that you have to use the bottom left and top right corner. Which is incorrect, You don’t use the corners, you use the sides.
[/quote]
There was just a misunderstanding then. But I was referring to

public boolean inWild() {
if(absX > 3322 && absX <2947 && absY > 3322 && absY < 3206) {
return true;
}
return false;
}
im going out but if this is unsolved when I get back I will kep helping.

What I was wondering was, how could a co-ordinate be bigger than 3322 and smaller than 2947 at the same time?[/quote]
Ah, ok

Well I guess whoever typed that fucked up a bit then.

Read full topic
